column4: hello; i have installed thunderbird 3 over my old thunderbird 2 profile; everything works okay, but there are two folders with the name of my two accounts that are empty and cannot be removed: http://img706.imageshack.us/i/thunderbird3.png/; can anyone help me  to remove them?
try to rename them and then delete them? maybe
i'll try that
you can also try in nautilus as root i think its sudo nautilus,...or something i've been useing kubuntu  so gnome is still fresh to me
i can not rename them
try to then in "sudo nautilus" in the terminal it'll open  nautilus in root so make sure you want them gone for real
can you please take a look at the image, i want to get rid of the folders, not my acounts: http://img706.imageshack.us/i/thunderbird3.png/
itll open nautilus with root privileges and you can navigate to the folder so you can delete them.... thats why i said make sure you want them gone.
okay, i'll check if they exist in the file hierarchy
i can't locate them in the .thunderbird directory, i think they were created inside thunderbird 3
maybe it is not possible to remove them :/
it is, when you open nautilus  with root, just navigate to the folder you want as if normal....
just be carefull as root
i think we misunderstand each other, these folders are "virtual" folders that corrspond to different files in the filesystem, have you looked at my screeenshot?
i didnt realized they were virtual folders,
they should be in your home folder still maybe under the hidden folders
thunderbird stores its stuff in ~/.thunderbird
then open nautilus in root navigate to !/.thunderbird and look for the files ya may have to hit ctrl+H in each folder to see the hidden files....
i had to find where my drive_c was in wine since some how i or the system must have put it in a different place.
i don't think you get my problem, but thanks anyway for being helpful
:0 good luck
